body:
- Jon likes to caress Tormund’s beard, especially after sex

- Tormund loves Jon’s thighs

- Jon can’t sleep because Tormund’s snoring

- Tormund complains about Jon loves Ghost more than him, but he loves to see them together

- Tormund doesn’t know how to behave in public and Jon loves it

- Jon is grumpy in the morning and Tormund enjoys annoying him

- They are a bit dirty in bed but not rudes


I don’t have proof but I don’t have doubts

blog.title: A Daughter's Storm

Writer, I like writing pregnancy plots,    
 So, take that as you will

title: This Land Pt. Three
body:
You woke up, strong arms wrapped around your body. The arms to the person had you pulled into his chest, which was slowly rising and falling to the beat of his lungs. He was wearing a black cloak. And the fur was tickling your cheeks. But the thick, black cotton was draped over your frame. You could feel it against your bare arms and neck.

Your shirt? Resting on the back of a chair, neatly. Your heavy shoes next to the shirt, in the chair.

Who was he? Your eyes opened and looked up to see the scruff on someone’s jaw and cheeks. Jon? It came rushing back to you. All of it. The sight of the fire growing higher and- you whimpered suddenly and Jon’s arms squeezed you a bit as his eyes opened slightly to try and sneak a look down at you. But you hid your face in his neck. The top of your head on the bottom of his chin.

“Shhh” He soothed, rubbing your back “It’s okay. It’s over.”

He thought of it quickly, to get your mind off of the burning and death of a man you didn’t know and onto something he thought would be calming.

“Tell me, what’s your homeland like?”

Your breathing went from uneven and rough to smooth and calming as you thought about it. You swear he could feel the gears turning in your head through your skull. But as you thought about it, you calmed down.

“Large. Bright lights everywhere.” You stated. Both of your arms folded up against your chest and each of your legs on either side of his leg that was closest to the ceiling.

“What is it called?” Jon asked, playing with the ends of your hair as if in a trance.

“Well, I’m from the city of San Diego. The state of California, and the country of the United States. I’ve never really left home… Jesus I miss my mom.” You sobbed out.

Was it an instinct for him to pull you even closer to his body? Maybe. Or maybe he just felt like you needed the comfort.

You wrapped your arms around his torso as well, holding him close. You barley knew this man, he looked strong enough to kill you with his bare hands. Yet you trusted him completely.

You looked up at him, so close to his face and pulled out of his arms and rolled out of the bed, walking to your old backpack, pulling out your mother’s walkman and crawling back into bed and into his arms.

You had paired the walkman with your ear buds when your mother gave it to you when she grounded you. But you took one of the buds and reached up to Jon’s ear that was facing the ceiling and placed it in. He gave you a strange look as you took the other and put it in your own ear before looking down at the walkman and pressing play.

He noticeably jumped when the music started, but he kept eye contact with you as the Micheal Jackson song started.

They told him don’t you ever come around here

Don’t want to see your face, you better disappear

The fire’s in their eyes and their words are really clear

So beat it, just beat it

He only smiled and shook his head slightly “You’re full of surprises aren’t you?”

You only shrugged, snuggling close into his warm embrace, letting the music play through the cassette tape and into the ear buds peacefully even if it was the most hyper song on the list.

Lying in my bed I hear the clock tick

And think of you

Caught up in circles

Confusion is nothing new

Flashback, warm nights

Almost left behind

Suitcases of memories

Time after time

You looked up at him before back down at his chest and wrapped your arm around his waist singing along to the lyrics

“Sometimes you picture me I’m walking too far ahead You’re calling to me, I can’t hear What you’ve said Then you say, go slow I fall behind The second hand unwinds”

Melisandre and Stannis had left and that meant the only person you truly trusted while in Castle Black was Jon.


•


The jacket was zipped up as you sat down across from the maester, Jon sitting right next him.

“How are you feeling?”

“Oh, like a hundred year old man slowly freezing to death.”

You smiled at that, looking around at books and stood to check them out. You had always loved reading. Though it wasn’t a passion, you did enjoy it greatly.

They continued to talk as you slipped a book out of it’s place. It looked like it hadn’t been touched in years from the amount of dust on it.

You knew what they were talking about. Jon had spoken to you about the wildlings. Perhaps in an attempt to know what to do. Even though he was the one in charge he felt as if he needed advice. Though you supposed that a came with the territory of being in charge of people.

Was he in charge of you? A girl who knew how to use guns and bows, and who always secretly carried a switch blade in her bag? Even though if she was caught at school she’d get suspended?


A girl who told her Platoon Commander to ‘get fucked?’ And then proceeded to argue with Commander and Master Gunns?

You were never really good with whatever this feeling towards that you had towards Jon. Fondness? Maybe. You had friends of course, and you would have done anything for them. But he- You didn’t know how to explain the twenty year old pretty boy.

You gazed over at Jon only to see him looking back at you. You both quickly looked away from each other. A deep pink spreading across your cheeks as you opened the book to a random page and made a face at the awful hand writing. That was held in the book. You could hear the Maester laugh.


•


“And her?”

Jon turned to look at you as you read from a book you had ‘snuck’ out of the library. It was quite obvious to him when he saw the bulky thing pushing the boundaries of you bag. You had that… thing playing in your ears. And the beat of a song could be heard from where he and Tormund where sitting.

“You can trust her. She has no ill will against anyone here. She’s-“

“Not from here? You think I didn’t notice the moment she ran up those stairs to get that bow? If she was from here she’d quietly sit by.”

Jon sighed slightly and nodded “She has a good heart. But I don’t know where it lies.” Tormund only gave Jon a knowing look.

“You like her.”

Jon ignored the question Tormund had asked, that didn’t even really sound like a question. 

“You’ll go north. Gather the remaining free folk wherever they are and bring them back here. I’ll open the gates for them and let them through. I’ll find them lands to settle south of the wall.”

“They won’t kneel for you and neither will I.” Tormund responded.

“I don’t want them to kneel for me. I want them to fight with me when the time comes.” Jon shot back.

You took an earbud out and looked up from your stolen book to watch and hear the argument clearly.

“The day I ask my people to fight with the crows is the day my people cut my guts from my belly and make me eat them”

“Can I interrupt?” You asked

“Ah, so she has a voice!” Tormund exclaimed looking at you with a small, interested smile on his face.

“Y/N?”

You gave Jon a nervous smile before turning to Tormund. “I don’t know, fully what’s going on. But I do know that whatever it is… It’s bad. Where I’m from bad things happen a lot. Throughout history and even in modern day. A lot of treaties have been signed before. With countries who have been at war for centuries and centuries.”

Tormund raised a brow and nodded once “Like?”

“Like France and England. Spain and England. Spain a long time ago was okay with England. After all, their princess Cathrine married the king of England. It created an alliance. But… when the king annulled their marriage for another woman, things went south. And France… Well… they fought a war for a 116 years. And she my country succeeded from England and won a major battle against them. The French and Spanish allied with us against them. Cause England was a common enemy.”

“Girl, we aren’t fighting a kingdom-“

“No, you’re not. But you’re both fighting a common enemy. You can fight them, defeat them and then fight each other. Just don’t make the job easier for them by killing each other off before who ever it is gets here. Don’t let the men women and children die because of your pride. Only idiot kings do that. But you don’t look a king. Or an idiot.”

Jon tilted his head in curiosity and Tormund smiled. “I like her…They’re at Hardhome. And If I’m going, you two are as well.”


•


You sat on Jon’s bed as he wrote things down. You could practically see the wrinkles permanently forming on his forehead while he wrote. Your history text book and ROTC field manual next to you as you watched him intently. You wanted to interrupt him, to make the wrinkle of stress be erased from his forehead.

But instead you let out a small sigh from your nose before reaching for the walkman and putting your earbuds in. Pressing play you could hear the intro of Fast Car. Your dad always loved this song.

You picked up the book you had taken from the library and began reading, humming to the lyrics of the song. Reading about something called ‘The Dance of Dragons’

You were deep into the book by now. Having been reading wherever you and Jon went.

Ever since Stannis had yelled at you for letting Jon kill Mance with an arrow and since he and Millsandre had left, you had found a calm company with Jon. Not wanting to be alone in such a strange place. You followed him like a lost puppy most days. Your nose in a book.

You figured he’d taken some sort of liking to you since you met him. He no longer looked at you like you were strange. He often brought you food, and water while you held the fort that was his room down.

You felt something in the world go slightly askew as Jessie’s Girl began to play right after and you stopped humming. You slowly raised your head to see Jon staring at you. His face relaxed, but filled with adoration.That’s the only word you could find to describe the look he was giving you for a few long, music filled moments before he looked down. You sucked in a breath and looked down at your book before smiling slightly.

“How old are you?”

He looked back at you, eyes slightly wide that you had acknowledged him just mere seconds after you caught him staring at you

“Twenty.”

“I’m sixteen.” You responded with a small smile. “wanna play Penny for Your Backstory?”

Jon rose a brow quizzically at you “Penny?” You nodded. “Come on, sit over here.” You encouraged, taking your headphones off and turning the walkman off as you reached for your bag, pulling out your wallet and dumping a large pile of Pennys on the center of the bed before you climbed to sit across from him. “C’mon! We can change it up!”

He smiled slightly and sat down on the floor his arms and chin resting on the furs as he picked up the currency of money that was useless to you, that you always got back when buying lunch. This had to be the past three years worth of pennies, just from lunch, and from your laziness on not putting it in the ‘Pasta for Pennies’ jar at school.

He looked at one particularly rusted one and looked at it funny, “In God We Trust? Liberty? 1964?”

“1964!?” You questioned happily snatching the small coin from his hands looking at the year with a bright smile on your face.

“This was 55 years ago!” You said putting it back in your wallet “Ariani’s gonna love this.”

“What does all of it mean?”

“Well… In God We Trust is there because my country was partly founded on the fact that everyone wanted to follow their own religion. But it was a different branch of Christianity. So… In God We Trust. Liberty is French, for Freedom.” You explained. “And the number is the year it was made. So-“

You picked up another coin and flipped it to look at the profile of Abraham Lincoln “2003” You said holding it up proudly. “The year I was born!”

Jon only nodded, trying to keep up with what you were saying about your money.

“And the man?”

You only smiled “Our sixteenth president. Abraham Lincoln. He was shot and killed during a play.” You said flipping the coin up in the air and catching it as it came down.

“We could do the get to know me version? You ask a question and based on how personal it is we get to choose the amount coins we get from it. Person who has zero coins left gets asked one major personal question, and they can’t say no. And we both have to answer the question.”

Jon only nodded once more as you split up the coins in half. Half for him, half for yourself.

“You start.” You encouraged.

“Are you a noble woman?”

“That’s two coins.”

He looked at you and dug two out of his pile and tossing them across the bed.

“No.” You answered putting the two into your pile.

You studied him, making a visual outline of his silhouette and saving it in the back of your mind.

“You come from a noble family?” You asked back, thinking he had forgotten the rules for a moment

“Yes.”

You woke up, strong arms wrapped around your body. The arms to the person had you pulled into his chest, which was slowly rising and falling to the beat of his lungs. He was wearing a black cloak. And the fur was tickling your cheeks. But the thick, black cotton was draped over your frame. You could feel it against your bare arms and neck.

[[MORE]]

Your shirt? Resting on the back of a chair, neatly. Your heavy shoes next to the shirt, in the chair.

Who was he? Your eyes opened and looked up to see the scruff on someone’s jaw and cheeks. Jon? It came rushing back to you. All of it. The sight of the fire growing higher and- you whimpered suddenly and Jon’s arms squeezed you a bit as his eyes opened slightly to try and sneak a look down at you. But you hid your face in his neck. The top of your head on the bottom of his chin.

“Shhh” He soothed, rubbing your back “It’s okay. It’s over.”

He thought of it quickly, to get your mind off of the burning and death of a man you didn’t know and onto something he thought would be calming.

“Tell me, what’s your homeland like?”

Your breathing went from uneven and rough to smooth and calming as you thought about it. You swear he could feel the gears turning in your head through your skull. But as you thought about it, you calmed down.

“Large. Bright lights everywhere.” You stated. Both of your arms folded up against your chest and each of your legs on either side of his leg that was closest to the ceiling.

“What is it called?” Jon asked, playing with the ends of your hair as if in a trance.

“Well, I’m from the city of San Diego. The state of California, and the country of the United States. I’ve never really left home… Jesus I miss my mom.” You sobbed out.

Was it an instinct for him to pull you even closer to his body? Maybe. Or maybe he just felt like you needed the comfort.

You wrapped your arms around his torso as well, holding him close. You barley knew this man, he looked strong enough to kill you with his bare hands. Yet you trusted him completely.

You looked up at him, so close to his face and pulled out of his arms and rolled out of the bed, walking to your old backpack, pulling out your mother’s walkman and crawling back into bed and into his arms.

You had paired the walkman with your ear buds when your mother gave it to you when she grounded you. But you took one of the buds and reached up to Jon’s ear that was facing the ceiling and placed it in. He gave you a strange look as you took the other and put it in your own ear before looking down at the walkman and pressing play.

He noticeably jumped when the music started, but he kept eye contact with you as the Micheal Jackson song started.

They told him don’t you ever come around here

Don’t want to see your face, you better disappear

The fire’s in their eyes and their words are really clear

So beat it, just beat it

He only smiled and shook his head slightly “You’re full of surprises aren’t you?”

You only shrugged, snuggling close into his warm embrace, letting the music play through the cassette tape and into the ear buds peacefully even if it was the most hyper song on the list.

Lying in my bed I hear the clock tick

And think of you

Caught up in circles

Confusion is nothing new

Flashback, warm nights

Almost left behind

Suitcases of memories

Time after time

You looked up at him before back down at his chest and wrapped your arm around his waist singing along to the lyrics

“Sometimes you picture me I’m walking too far ahead You’re calling to me, I can’t hear What you’ve said Then you say, go slow I fall behind The second hand unwinds”

Melisandre and Stannis had left and that meant the only person you truly trusted while in Castle Black was Jon.


•


The jacket was zipped up as you sat down across from the maester, Jon sitting right next him.

“How are you feeling?”

“Oh, like a hundred year old man slowly freezing to death.”

You smiled at that, looking around at books and stood to check them out. You had always loved reading. Though it wasn’t a passion, you did enjoy it greatly.

They continued to talk as you slipped a book out of it’s place. It looked like it hadn’t been touched in years from the amount of dust on it.

You knew what they were talking about. Jon had spoken to you about the wildlings. Perhaps in an attempt to know what to do. Even though he was the one in charge he felt as if he needed advice. Though you supposed that a came with the territory of being in charge of people.

Was he in charge of you? A girl who knew how to use guns and bows, and who always secretly carried a switch blade in her bag? Even though if she was caught at school she’d get suspended?


A girl who told her Platoon Commander to ‘get fucked?’ And then proceeded to argue with Commander and Master Gunns?

You were never really good with whatever this feeling towards that you had towards Jon. Fondness? Maybe. You had friends of course, and you would have done anything for them. But he- You didn’t know how to explain the twenty year old pretty boy.

You gazed over at Jon only to see him looking back at you. You both quickly looked away from each other. A deep pink spreading across your cheeks as you opened the book to a random page and made a face at the awful hand writing. That was held in the book. You could hear the Maester laugh.


•


“And her?”

Jon turned to look at you as you read from a book you had ‘snuck’ out of the library. It was quite obvious to him when he saw the bulky thing pushing the boundaries of you bag. You had that… thing playing in your ears. And the beat of a song could be heard from where he and Tormund where sitting.

“You can trust her. She has no ill will against anyone here. She’s-“

“Not from here? You think I didn’t notice the moment she ran up those stairs to get that bow? If she was from here she’d quietly sit by.”

Jon sighed slightly and nodded “She has a good heart. But I don’t know where it lies.” Tormund only gave Jon a knowing look.

“You like her.”

Jon ignored the question Tormund had asked, that didn’t even really sound like a question. 

“You’ll go north. Gather the remaining free folk wherever they are and bring them back here. I’ll open the gates for them and let them through. I’ll find them lands to settle south of the wall.”

“They won’t kneel for you and neither will I.” Tormund responded.

“I don’t want them to kneel for me. I want them to fight with me when the time comes.” Jon shot back.

You took an earbud out and looked up from your stolen book to watch and hear the argument clearly.

“The day I ask my people to fight with the crows is the day my people cut my guts from my belly and make me eat them”

“Can I interrupt?” You asked

“Ah, so she has a voice!” Tormund exclaimed looking at you with a small, interested smile on his face.

“Y/N?”

You gave Jon a nervous smile before turning to Tormund. “I don’t know, fully what’s going on. But I do know that whatever it is… It’s bad. Where I’m from bad things happen a lot. Throughout history and even in modern day. A lot of treaties have been signed before. With countries who have been at war for centuries and centuries.”

Tormund raised a brow and nodded once “Like?”

“Like France and England. Spain and England. Spain a long time ago was okay with England. After all, their princess Cathrine married the king of England. It created an alliance. But… when the king annulled their marriage for another woman, things went south. And France… Well… they fought a war for a 116 years. And she my country succeeded from England and won a major battle against them. The French and Spanish allied with us against them. Cause England was a common enemy.”

“Girl, we aren’t fighting a kingdom-“

“No, you’re not. But you’re both fighting a common enemy. You can fight them, defeat them and then fight each other. Just don’t make the job easier for them by killing each other off before who ever it is gets here. Don’t let the men women and children die because of your pride. Only idiot kings do that. But you don’t look a king. Or an idiot.”

Jon tilted his head in curiosity and Tormund smiled. “I like her…They’re at Hardhome. And If I’m going, you two are as well.”


•


You sat on Jon’s bed as he wrote things down. You could practically see the wrinkles permanently forming on his forehead while he wrote. Your history text book and ROTC field manual next to you as you watched him intently. You wanted to interrupt him, to make the wrinkle of stress be erased from his forehead.

But instead you let out a small sigh from your nose before reaching for the walkman and putting your earbuds in. Pressing play you could hear the intro of Fast Car. Your dad always loved this song.

You picked up the book you had taken from the library and began reading, humming to the lyrics of the song. Reading about something called ‘The Dance of Dragons’

You were deep into the book by now. Having been reading wherever you and Jon went.

Ever since Stannis had yelled at you for letting Jon kill Mance with an arrow and since he and Millsandre had left, you had found a calm company with Jon. Not wanting to be alone in such a strange place. You followed him like a lost puppy most days. Your nose in a book.

You figured he’d taken some sort of liking to you since you met him. He no longer looked at you like you were strange. He often brought you food, and water while you held the fort that was his room down.

You felt something in the world go slightly askew as Jessie’s Girl began to play right after and you stopped humming. You slowly raised your head to see Jon staring at you. His face relaxed, but filled with adoration.That’s the only word you could find to describe the look he was giving you for a few long, music filled moments before he looked down. You sucked in a breath and looked down at your book before smiling slightly.

“How old are you?”

He looked back at you, eyes slightly wide that you had acknowledged him just mere seconds after you caught him staring at you

“Twenty.”

“I’m sixteen.” You responded with a small smile. “wanna play Penny for Your Backstory?”

Jon rose a brow quizzically at you “Penny?” You nodded. “Come on, sit over here.” You encouraged, taking your headphones off and turning the walkman off as you reached for your bag, pulling out your wallet and dumping a large pile of Pennys on the center of the bed before you climbed to sit across from him. “C’mon! We can change it up!”

He smiled slightly and sat down on the floor his arms and chin resting on the furs as he picked up the currency of money that was useless to you, that you always got back when buying lunch. This had to be the past three years worth of pennies, just from lunch, and from your laziness on not putting it in the ‘Pasta for Pennies’ jar at school.

He looked at one particularly rusted one and looked at it funny, “In God We Trust? Liberty? 1964?”

“1964!?” You questioned happily snatching the small coin from his hands looking at the year with a bright smile on your face.

“This was 55 years ago!” You said putting it back in your wallet “Ariani’s gonna love this.”

“What does all of it mean?”

“Well… In God We Trust is there because my country was partly founded on the fact that everyone wanted to follow their own religion. But it was a different branch of Christianity. So… In God We Trust. Liberty is French, for Freedom.” You explained. “And the number is the year it was made. So-“

You picked up another coin and flipped it to look at the profile of Abraham Lincoln “2003” You said holding it up proudly. “The year I was born!”

Jon only nodded, trying to keep up with what you were saying about your money.

“And the man?”

You only smiled “Our sixteenth president. Abraham Lincoln. He was shot and killed during a play.” You said flipping the coin up in the air and catching it as it came down.

“We could do the get to know me version? You ask a question and based on how personal it is we get to choose the amount coins we get from it. Person who has zero coins left gets asked one major personal question, and they can’t say no. And we both have to answer the question.”

Jon only nodded once more as you split up the coins in half. Half for him, half for yourself.

“You start.” You encouraged.

“Are you a noble woman?”

“That’s two coins.”

He looked at you and dug two out of his pile and tossing them across the bed.

“No.” You answered putting the two into your pile.

You studied him, making a visual outline of his silhouette and saving it in the back of your mind.

“You come from a noble family?” You asked back, thinking he had forgotten the rules for a moment

“Yes.”


•••

summary: I hate how people treats Arya’s traumas and pain as something glorious, like yes she is fucking strong for handeling all of that...
body:
I hate how people treats Arya’s traumas and pain as something glorious, like yes she is fucking strong for handeling all of that shit, but still she is not invencible, she is human, a traumatized kid that lost everything, and that is not something to glorify. During seven/eighth season the writers treat her like a kill machines who has no feelings and is able to kill her own sister, one of the only persons she has left, like, she doesn’t care, she has no feelings, because she is a strong female character and strong famale characters can’t have feelings, or feel vulnerable, or sad, or dealing with her traumas and pains for real, acording to them.

I have to give congratulations to maise Williams to make an amazing performance with such an superficial script, she gave her best to not make Arya looking like a killing machine, she is a great actress

title: After the Battle
body:
Written for Day 3 of @jonsadreamofspring based on the prompt “Winterfell”. Thank you anon for this amazing prompt and idea!

After the battle of Winterfell Jon can barely stand and move. But Sansa is there to help him and to wash away the blood of the undead.

Canon Compliant // post s08e03

“Jon?”

He couldn’t move. The adrenaline that had been rushing through his veins was gone now, just like the Night King and his army. The ice dragon he had been distracting so Arya could reach the Godswood and save them all had exploded right when he had feared that  they had failed and lost. The deafening sounds of clattering swords and screaming soldiers that had kept him going had stilled and now there was nothing but silence.

“Jon…”

He was still breathing. He could feel his chest moving up and down and he felt the cold wind touching his bloodied and dirty skin.

Her arm slid around his waist and she breathed heavily when she tried to lift him up. “It’s over, Jon.” She whispered and he groaned when he tried to put some weight on his soar and tired legs. “We won.” She used her shoulder to steady him and slowly she started walking.

He had no idea where they were going. He was too exhausted to focus on his surroundings and his mind was too tired to count the stairs they were climbing and the turns they were taking. He assumed she was bringing him to his chambers, but he wasn’t entirely sure.

“Thank you.” Even though she had just survived a nightmare her voice sounded confident and friendly when she spoke to the servant in the room. “I will take it from here. You deserve a good day of sleep after the night we’ve had.” She placed him on a wooden chair and her soft and delicate fingers started to take his clothes off.

He wanted to protest, wanted to tell her that she didn’t have to do this, that there were more important issues to take care of, but he couldn’t. His tongue and lips refused to form words and his muscles refused to move. He couldn’t keep her from taking off his coat and his armour. He couldn’t keep her from taking off hiss boots and his pants. And he also couldn’t keep her from taking off his breeches.

“It’s okay.” She wrapped an arm around his naked waist and helped him to get up from his chair. “I’ve got you.” She lead him to a wooden bathtub and without really thinking about it he stepped in.

The water was pleasantly warm, just like the rest of the room, and he allowed himself to sink into it until it reached his chin. His skin started glowing due to the clash of the cold and the heat, but the tingle all over his body reminded him that he was still alive.

“Jon?” Sansa kneeled down next to the tub. Her usually neat hairdo was now a mess and she had stripped down to her underdress. Her blue eyes however were reflecting the glow of the burning fire in the hearth. “I will wash away the blood and dirt, okay?”

He wanted to shake his head. He wanted to nod. He wanted to tell her that he could wash himself, but he knew he couldn’t. Instead he simply closed his eyes when she pressed the warm cloth to his cheek.

Her touch was soft and firm at once. First she washed his face. Then she cleaned his shoulders and chest. She moved on to his legs and feet and a soft chuckle escaped when she pressed the tip of the cloth between his toes.

He had never known a touch could be this pleasant.

“The Maester will have to check your wounds tomorrow. The cuts seem superficial.” She washed his abdomen and then the cloth went between his thighs.

His entire body responded. He felt a shiver of the pleasant kind rolling down his spine, his heart beat faster and faster in his aching chest and in the back of his mind a little voice screamed for more. But he wasn’t capable of more right now. He wasn’t even capable of talking and telling her what he really wanted and longed for.

Too quickly his entire body was cleaned and the moment was over.

Once more she wrapped an arm around his waist and helped him to stand up. She didn’t complain that he was soaking her dress. She didn’t say that he was heavy. She helped him stepping out of the cooling water and once he was seated on his wooden chair again she reached for a towel. With the same care and precision as she had washed him she now dried every inch of his skin. Carefully she dabbed the parts that were bruised or wounded, but even if she would have accidentally hurt him he wouldn’t have had the energy to moan.

He was Jon Snow. He had gathered the biggest army ever seen to fight the biggest war ever fought. But here he was, naked in front of a princess, a queen, unable to even mutter a simple thank you. No one should have seen him like this, but he was glad that at least it was Sansa. He wouldn’t have wanted it to be anyone else.

The wooden floor cracked under her bare feet when she walked to the closet to get him some clean underwear. And once more she kneeled down in front of him, this time to help him put it on. And again her arm slid around his waist to help him up, this time to lead him to his comfortable bed.

His muscles relaxed when his back touched the soft mattress and he almost drifted away immediately when she draped the warm blanket over him.

“Sleep well, Jon.” Her soft lips kissed his forehead. “You fought well today.”

He mustered the last bit of energy and willpower he had left in him. His fingers curled around her wrist and he pulled her back when she was about to walk away. “Stay…” His voice was hoarse and barely a whisper, but Sansa stood still. Normally he would have added a please, but this time he couldn’t.

She freed her wrist from his strong embrace, but then she took off her underdress and she lifted the blanket up again. When her body touched his he couldn’t fight his fatigue any longer, but Sansa draped his arm around her shoulders and curled up against his naked chest.

A smile spread across his face while he fell asleep.
body_abstract:
Written for Day 3 of @jonsadreamofspring based on the prompt “Winterfell”. Thank you anon for this amazing prompt and idea!

After the battle of Winterfell Jon can barely stand and move. But Sansa is there to help him and to wash away the blood of the undead.

Canon Compliant // post s08e03

“Jon?”

He couldn’t move. The adrenaline that had been rushing through his veins was gone now, just like the Night King and his army. The ice dragon he had been distracting so Arya could reach the Godswood and save them all had exploded right when he had feared that  they had failed and lost. The deafening sounds of clattering swords and screaming soldiers that had kept him going had stilled and now there was nothing but silence.

“Jon…”

He was still breathing. He could feel his chest moving up and down and he felt the cold wind touching his bloodied and dirty skin.

Her arm slid around his waist and she breathed heavily when she tried to lift him up. “It’s over, Jon.” She whispered and he groaned when he tried to put some weight on his soar and tired legs. “We won.” She used her shoulder to steady him and slowly she started walking.

He had no idea where they were going. He was too exhausted to focus on his surroundings and his mind was too tired to count the stairs they were climbing and the turns they were taking. He assumed she was bringing him to his chambers, but he wasn’t entirely sure.

“Thank you.” Even though she had just survived a nightmare her voice sounded confident and friendly when she spoke to the servant in the room. “I will take it from here. You deserve a good day of sleep after the night we’ve had.” She placed him on a wooden chair and her soft and delicate fingers started to take his clothes off.

He wanted to protest, wanted to tell her that she didn’t have to do this, that there were more important issues to take care of, but he couldn’t. His tongue and lips refused to form words and his muscles refused to move. He couldn’t keep her from taking off his coat and his armour. He couldn’t keep her from taking off hiss boots and his pants. And he also couldn’t keep her from taking off his breeches.

tags: she is an interesting and good character
i just feel like people should stop shitting on jon when he is acting similar to ppl in real life who are in toxic relationships
and that doesn't make him weak
maybe this is due to my own personal experiences clouding my judgement but this is how i interpreted his behaviour
summary: I don’t think Jon Snow became “weak” in season 8, he was simply a victim of being in a emotionally abusive, toxic relationship....
body:
I don’t think Jon Snow became “weak” in season 8, he was simply a victim of being in a emotionally abusive, toxic relationship. I know “You are my queen” and “I don’t want it” have kind of become a meme now, but I think it’s very similar to how people in emotionally abusive relationships repeat themselves when trying to deal with a volatile person and avoid conflict. When you have a partner you have to walk on eggshells around, even bringing up a minor issue to them can lead to them gaslighting you and reversing it, so you end up reassuring them. You repeat words of comfort to them. And you eventually stop telling them how you feel, and learn how to say the ‘right’ words. Him shutting Sansa down in the war council is similar. When you are in an emotionally abusive relationship with a volatile person whom you love, you try to do damage control and stop people from upsetting that person. 

This is also shown in the last episode, which many people criticised for being out of character for Jon. Tyrion needed to convince Jon that what Dany did was bad. When you love someone who is abusing you, you don’t see the red flags. You make excuses. I sure have in my experiences. You convince yourself your relationship is healthy, you are both in love, you trust this person with your life, they are a good person. You tell yourself those things until you believe them. In a lot of cases, the person stuck in the abusive relationship doesn’t see the reality of the situation. And it’s not til they get out that they begin to realise how it was not their fault and they were being emotionally manipulated. 

Being in a toxic relationship does make you out of character. It does make you defend that person. It does make you question yourself all the time. It does make you repeat yourself to that person. To others, it may seem like you have become a shadow of yourself, but I feel like calling Jon weak and spineless is uncalled for, because I see him as a victim.

reblog.comment:
I don’t think Jon Snow became “weak” in season 8, he was simply a victim of being in a emotionally abusive, toxic relationship. I know “You are my queen” and “I don’t want it” have kind of become a meme now, but I think it’s very similar to how people in emotionally abusive relationships repeat themselves when trying to deal with a volatile person and avoid conflict. When you have a partner you have to walk on eggshells around, even bringing up a minor issue to them can lead to them gaslighting you and reversing it, so you end up reassuring them. You repeat words of comfort to them. And you eventually stop telling them how you feel, and learn how to say the ‘right’ words. Him shutting Sansa down in the war council is similar. When you are in an emotionally abusive relationship with a volatile person whom you love, you try to do damage control and stop people from upsetting that person. 

This is also shown in the last episode, which many people criticised for being out of character for Jon. Tyrion needed to convince Jon that what Dany did was bad. When you love someone who is abusing you, you don’t see the red flags. You make excuses. I sure have in my experiences. You convince yourself your relationship is healthy, you are both in love, you trust this person with your life, they are a good person. You tell yourself those things until you believe them. In a lot of cases, the person stuck in the abusive relationship doesn’t see the reality of the situation. And it’s not til they get out that they begin to realise how it was not their fault and they were being emotionally manipulated. 

Being in a toxic relationship does make you out of character. It does make you defend that person. It does make you question yourself all the time. It does make you repeat yourself to that person. To others, it may seem like you have become a shadow of yourself, but I feel like calling Jon weak and spineless is uncalled for, because I see him as a victim.

summary:
how ruthless are the gentle - 
part v exerpt
“Perhaps to motivate you, we should play for something you want.”
She chuckled....
body:
how ruthless are the gentle -

part v exerpt

“Perhaps to motivate you, we should play for something you want.”

She chuckled. “Indeed. And what is your opinion, Black Prince? What do I want?”

Jon went for straight for the throat.

“Winterfell.”

The smile fell and for a moment - a single, fleeting moment - he caught a glimpse of the woman that lay beneath the silks, the beauty and the courtesies of the perfect lady. In that moment they looked at each other in perfect recognition. Jon felt his heart speed up its drumming against his ribs.

“Winterfell?” The word was half a whisper on her lips.

“Yes. Win, and next time I go north, which will be soon because I am expected, I will take you with me.”

He said it with the same certainty he would state the sky was blue. Sansa remained pale however, her face a stone mask. She didn’t believe him of course. Jon knew this, even as her face showed him nothing. She’d become stone. This time when she looked up from the board, her eyes were not kind. She looked at him and Jon felt as if she’d pressed the flat of a blade against his cheek.

A shiver ripped down his spine, raising the hair on the back of his neck.

But then she blinked, and her expression settled into something more placid that Jon instantly hated; almost as much as he hated the smile she gave him.

“We might as well play for the moon, your grace.” She spoke gently; would have looked softer if she’d been made of steel.

Your grace. Are you reminding yourself who I am? Did you forget?   

“If I win however, you will have to give me something I want.”

summary: Jon Snow Being Your Mentor Would Include...
body:
Jon Snow Being Your Mentor Would Include…

•Being a bastard child yourself

•Immediately begging John to be your mentor when you get the chance to meet him. He’s hesitant at first but thanks to your persistence he eventually agrees

•Theon and Robb teasing Jon at first because you always follow him around but eventually they become a little jealous that no one wants them to be their mentor

•Jon teaching you how to fight and him eventually giving you a sword

  • “It’s the most magnificent thing I’ve ever seen. Thank you m’lord”

•Your mentor being extremely protective of you and him doing everything he can to keep you out of danger

•Jon viewing you as a little sibling or even his child

•Referring to Jon as m’lord and him consistently insisting that there’s no need for you to address him that way. However to this day you’ve never called him his first name unless you thought that you may not see him again

•Constantly being in awe of everything Jon does and him trying to be humble everytime you praise him

  • “You’re the greatest man in the seven kingdoms m’lord”
  • “I don’t know about that little one…”

•Wishing that Jon would see himself the way you see him, which is a good man who does his best for the people he cares about

•Being more than willing to follow Jon to the ends of the Earth because you trust him more than anyone else

•Fighting right beside Jon during the battle of the bastards

•Jon’s goal to not make you like him but more so better than him

REQUESTS ARE CLOSED
